title: Senior Industry Architect, Healthcare
content:
Build the future of data. Join the Snowflake team.Our Sales Engineering organization is seeking a Senior Industry Architect focused in building data and analytics solutions for Healthcare payer or provider clients to join our Field CTO Office who can provide leadership in working with both technical and business stakeholders in the design and architecture of the Snowflake Cloud Data Platform as a critical component of their enterprise data architecture and overall ecosystem.
In this role, you will work with healthcare industry sales teams, Industry SMEs, and system integration partners to develop best practices and reference architectures highlighting Snowflake’s Cloud Data Platform as a core technology enabling platform for various business functions and use cases of a typical healthcare payer or provider organization.
As a Senior Industry Architect for healthcare, you must share our passion and vision in helping our customers and partners drive faster time to insight through Snowflake’s Cloud Data Platform, thrive in a dynamic environment, and have the flexibility and willingness to jump in and get things done. You are equally comfortable in both healthcare business and technical context, interacting with business teams and talking shop with technical audiences. 
IN THIS ROLE YOU WILL GET TO:

Apply your data and analytics architecture expertise while presenting Snowflake technology and vision to business audience and technical contributors at strategic prospects, customers, and partners
Work with our internal industry solution development team and partners to conceptualize and build solutions for healthcare business functions that can serve as accelerator for customers to jump start various healthcare use case implementations on Snowflake 
Partner with healthcare sales team and channel partners to understand the needs of our customers,  strategize on how to navigate and accelerate winning sales cycles, provide compelling value-based enterprise architecture deliverables and working sessions to ensure customers are set up for success operationally, and support strategic enterprise pilots / proof-of-concepts 
Partner with Product Marketing teams to spread awareness and support pipeline building via blogs, webinars, and whitepapers
Contribute to the creation of healthcare reference architectures, blueprints, best practices, etc. based on field experience to up-level and enable our internal stakeholders and Snowflake Powered by Program

ON DAY ONE, WE WILL EXPECT YOU TO HAVE:
Must have

10+ years of full stack data and analytics architecture experience with a deep understanding of how to scale applications
3+ years of Cloud Provider (AWS, Azure or GCP) customer facing architecture development experience
3 to 5 years of experience working or consulting for Healthcare payer or provider organization is a must
Solid understanding of healthcare payer or provider business is required with good exposure in handling healthcare data
Strong Knowledge of SQL, Python with hands-on experience is required. Experience in Java, Scala, or other languages is a plus
Good communication skills to be able to write external facing technical blogs and excellent presentation skills on technical content

Good to have

Experience with Snowflake is a plus
Outstanding presentation skills to both technical and business audiences, whether impromptu on a whiteboard or using presentations and demos
Broad range of experience with on-prem and/or cloud databases
Bachelor’s Degree required, Masters Degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics or related fields, or equivalent experience preferred.

Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.
How do you want to make your impact?

questions.label: Where have you most recently worked?
Have you worked at Snowflake in the past in a Full-time, Part-time, contractor or Intern capacity?
For Snowflake to anticipate possible immigration timelines and obligations, could you confirm you are currently authorized to work in the country to which you are applying?

Will you require sponsorship to continue or extend your current work authorization status, either now or in the future (Example – including but not limited to: work permits such as H-1B in the United States, Highly Skilled Migrant in the Netherlands or a Blue Card in Poland or Germany. This could also include change of sponsorship from your current employer to Snowflake)?
A “U.S. person” is a citizen, legal permanent resident, or legal temporary resident (i.e., a refugee or asylee) of the United States. Which of the following best describes your “U.S. person” status?

values.label: I am a citizen of Cuba, Iran, North Korea, or Syria AND I am NOT a U.S. person.
None of the above; I am a citizen of a different country.

questions.label: [US Applicants Only] Are you subject to any post-employment restrictions based on your role as a government (federal, state, local, or otherwise) employee or contractor, including representational restrictions or restrictions arising from work on a government procurement?
Due to SEC auditor independence requirements, please let us know whether you have previously worked at, or if currently working at PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC), who is our independent auditor.

values.label: Yes - I have previously worked at, or is currently working at PwC.
No - I have never been employed by PwC.

questions.description: When you apply to a job on this site, the personal data contained in your application will be collected by Snowflake. Your personal data will be processed for the purposes of managing Snowflake’s recruitment related activities, which include setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing the results thereto, and as is otherwise needed in the recruitment and hiring processes. Such processing is legally permissible under Art. 6(1)(f) of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (General Data Protection Regulation) as necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by Snowflake, which are the solicitation, evaluation, and selection of applicants for employment. Snowflake will share your personal data with Greenhouse Software, Inc., a cloud services provider located in the United States of America and engaged by Snowflake to help manage its recruitment and hiring process on Snowflake’s behalf. Accordingly, if you are located outside of the United States, your personal data will be transferred to the United States once you submit it through this site and such transfer will be subject to appropriate safeguards under standard contractual clauses as approved by the European Union Commission and/or the Privacy Shield framework. Further information about how Snowflake processes your personal data can be found in our Privacy Notice (the term “privacy notice” to be a link to our privacy notice located at https://www.snowflake.com/privacy-policy/ ). Your personal data will be retained by Snowflake as long as we determine it is necessary to evaluate your application for employment. You have the right to data portability, to request access to your personal data, to request that your personal data be rectified or erased, and to request that processing of your personal data be restricted. Such requests can be made by contacting us at privacy@snowflake.com.
questions.label: Point of Data Transfer
